result.execSummary:
The defendant Krysta Lynn Lathrop was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Krysta Lynn Lathrop is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Krysta Lynn Lathrop was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: St Croix County Clerk of Circuit Court
St Croix County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Counts 2, 3 and 4.
Defendant to report to Probation today October 27, 2015 by 2:45 p.m.
Probation to run concurrent with Eau Claire County.
Defendant is eligible for expungement upon successful completion of Probation.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Concurrent with: Eau Claire County

miscConds.notes:
$243.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CM545.
$200.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CM545.
Psychological/Psychiatric Evaluation within 30 days and follow recommended treatment.

-Cooperate with any other Evaluation, Assessment and/or Program as requested by Agent.
-Defendant to provide a DNA sample.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.
-NO CONTACT whatsoever with Edgar F.
-Subject to random UA's and PBT's.
-Follow all rules and regulations of Agent.
-Pay Supervision fees.

Condition time, STAYED.
Concurrent with: Eau Claire County

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Minot,ADA:  Sharon Correll   DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton   DF:  Krysta Lynn Lathrop appeared. Case called at 1:58 pm. There is an agreement. Atty Caton recites. No objection from ADA Correll. Count one is amended to be without domestic abuse enhancer. Court reviews constitutional rights with Def. Court finds Def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights. Court reads charge and possible penalties for amended count one, Def pleads guilty. Court uses complaints and reports as factual basis, accepts plea and adjudicates Def guilty of amended count one. Counts two - four are dismissed. 
Court orders 1 year probation w/h with conditions - 
- 45 Days Jail STAYED
- Court Costs
- DNA Surcharge; Apply Bond
- Psychological/ Psychiatric Evaluation if requested
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested
- DNA Sample and Surcharge
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license
- No Contact with E. Flowers
- Sign up for probation by 10/27/2015
- Subject to random UA's and PBT's
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent
- Pay supervision fees

Probation to run concurrent with charges in Eau Claire County. Eligible for expungement upon successful completion of probation.

per def in writing. sf
Status conference at 09-10-2015 02:30 pm

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, E. Flowers.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
